question: Why do people raise dogs inside the house if they are not hygienic and poop and pee all over the house?
details: To quote you in my answer - I agree.  People who are not hygienic and poop and pee all over the house should NOT raise dogs inside the house.

answers.answer: To quote you in my answer - I agree.  People who are not hygienic and poop and pee all over the house should NOT raise dogs inside the house.
comments: This one deserves best answer!

answers.answer: Because they are either too lazy to let the dog out (extreme temp is not an excuse) or they haven't bothered to teach the dog where it should be going.
Because they aren't Muslim.
I have a Husky that spends the majority of his time indoors. He has never done either in the house. If someone can't raise a dog properly then they shouldn't own one!
Because it’s better than leaving them outside when it’s below freezing or when it’s like 100 degrees outside.

Because they're lonely and sad and they want some dumb creature to make them feel superior.
I guess for some reason you have never heard of training a dog to go outside.
Because they are not far from doing the same thing in their house.
Yes they are
No they are lovely.
they can be really cruel to mice
No they are lovely.
They kinda are....  They do kill things for fun
Not in the least.
Learn how to properly format a sentence. And for the record, no they are not, and anyone who thinks so is a deranged idiot that I would never hope to meet.
No cats are not evil. I wish there was more context to this question...

question: What type of lizard is this?
details: I found this weird-looking lizard along the edge of a bayou near Lake Pontchartrain. It looked like a baby. I've never seen anything like this before.

answers.answer: Report that to the FBI immediately and wash your hands
That is a photo shopped image, as Gretchen already pointed out. It has been bouncing around several dinosaur related sites and is supposed to look like a Spinosaurus.

Its a European newt. Like a previous person mentioned it was probably sold as a pet and escaped. If you zoom in you can see a tiny elevated ridge line on the tail as well as the back  This is why I think an European newt is the most likely species.
omg, it looks like a little dinnasoar

I believe this photo is photoshopped. No lizards exactly resemble this. It looks like as if someone was trying to make the lizard look a Spinosaurus. (An extinct dinosaur infamous for having a sail on its back and a long crocodile-like snout)
comments: I share your suspicion.

answers.answer: It looks more like a basilisk than anything else but there are no records of them in the USA outside of Florida. I suggest taking it to Tulane and asking the herpetologist. If it

Your location is near New Orleans Louisiana. There is no animal that would fit this description within the USA. Some newts in Europe have dorsal fins that look vaguely similar to this one. It also appears to have smooth skin. That makes it unlikely to be a lizard as lizards have scaly skin. European newts are sometimes sold as pets in the USA. Perhaps it is an escaped pet that is a European newt.
looks like a baby dinosaur wtf

question: Why would 9 kittens disappear overnight?
details: Cause they went looking for number 10

answers.answer: Cause they went looking for number 10

Kittens are prey for raccoons, dogs, raptors (birds) or other cats. The mother cat may have moved them--or hidden them, or something may have taken them. Humans also steal kittens for sport, abuse or labs. Almost anything could have happened.
Maybe mother cat took it away or your mother.
If outside, there are many predators that would kill kittens.
Mom moved them
mothers sometimes move kittens if she feels they aren
Their mother moved them to a new, safer location,. It happens.
mommy cats have been known to move their kittens .......................
1 - Mommy moved them to get away from you;
Snake bait, coyote food, catnapped for nefarious reasons, mother hiding them.
comments: thank you

question: My 1 month old puppy stopped pooing on the training pad?
details: Is it too early to train a puppy of <4 weeks?

answers.answer: No, no shelter woud allow anyone to 'adopt' 4 weeks old pups...... you have zero sense/knowledge or you are trolling
answer to follow
Hard to believe your story.  Do NAME the shelter that allowed you to "ADOPT" a 4 week old puppy?  (Bet you can't name a real shelter - who will back your story up)  because this action WAS ILLEGAL!
comments: kitchen floor, where they skid-land and dance triumphantly until big mean old Les  catches one and slides it out the door before a sibling can get into the kitchen. The jOYS of puppyhood!

answers.answer: The pup is way too young at  4 weeks to be expected to learn where to relieve himself.
comments: 4: The "ambling room" should have its floor protected by layers of old newspaper.
I'm curious:
Why did YOU never produce a litter❓

answers.answer: For starters, I'm really surprised (horrified even) that the Shelter allowed you to take one of these puppies home AT ONLY 4 WEEKS.   At this age, they should all be together and in a suitable place where doing what your puppy is doing, is ok.   As it is, your puppy has been deprived of the valuable play-time with his siblings - sad.
comments: The breeder shouldn't be breeding dogs if they don't want the responsibility of the puppies for the first 2 months.

answers.answer: Even if not with their mother it is important for their development that puppies stay together with their littermates until at least 6 weeks of age, 8 - 10 weeks is better.
comments: @Kreaky Kiwi, Not sure what your rambling anecdotes are supposed to prove. Perhaps try adding a coherent answer of your own rather than hijacking every other answer. We are agreed that at 4 weeks, this pup is far to young to toilet train or seperate from litter mates so not sure why you commented.

answers.answer: Hes too young.  And you're going to have a hard time training him.  He really needed to stay with littermates until at least 8-10 weeks of age

question: How long does it take an animal facility to Euthanize a dog?
details: I got my nieghbors dog impounded

answers.answer: Dogs found running loose (vs surrendered pets by owner) have a longer amount of time to be held (usually a week) but it varies.  The owner will have to PAY a fine, to get it back and if it has happened before (or again) the fine GOES UP.
Your neighbor will get 72+ hrs to claim the dog.

It seems wrong to put down a neighbors dog just because you don't like it! How would it be if we killed people because they annoyed us? Plus, you don't have the owner's knowledge or consent, which is definitely illegal.
comments: Actually read the question.  It doesnt say that the individual dog is aggressive, the asker only commented on the dog's breed

answers.answer: Generally at least 3 days, more commonly 7 - 10 days.
If the dog was really a threat, how’d you tie it up and take off the collar?

If it's legitimately aggressive and acts that way with the pound... I dunno, depends on their rules. If the dog itself is not aggressive and you're just saying it is based on the breed, then they'll probably give the owners time to come looking for it and otherwise possibly put it up for adoption if they don't.
comments: It sounds like it was aggressive and it was on the askers lawn.

answers.answer: Honestly, this is an issue I feel is best discussed in person. If you could tell me what town you live in, so that I can meet you somewhere, I'd appreciate it.

question: Am I wrong for not wanting to live with my gfs untrained dog?!?
details: It’s been almost 5 yrs with my gf. I love her, but her dog is untrained and defecates all over the house and furniture. I’m at a place in my life where I want nice things and want them to stay nice, I work hard for the stuff I have. It’s been 3 yrs since we’ve moved in together and she says that she will fix the dog but nothing ever changes. It’s not a day that goes by that I don’t smell poop or urine, it’s everyday at this point which has forced to put my interest in moving out. Has nothing to do with my gf she’s amazing but the dog I can’t deal with and she said she’s not getting rid of the dog. Trained or untrained. I just don’t want to seem like a bad guy, but the place smells like a zoo and it never gets better. I’ve bought rugs, that have been ruined in less than a week, multiple rugs, it also urinated on our brand new mattress and couch.

answers.answer: The dogs not trained? Sounds like she’s not trained. To walk the dog
Dog: "Am I wrong for wanting to maul my owner's untrained, dog-hating boyfriend? Also, he urinates and sh*ts everywhere and blames it on me because he is a dog hating pussy."
comments: 300 IQ comment right here, give this man a trophy

answers.answer: Why on earth do you put up with this?  It's unsafe--unhygienic--and ridiculous. And you've done it for 3 years???
comments: Well said Christian... totally agree with your answer.

answers.answer: You're not wrong.
Nope you aint.....................I´d leave her  rather than living in a dogs sewer. In all truth also... Ivé got no time for such folk in all honesty.
You are not wrong. The amazing gf isn't so amazing if she lets this filth and health hazard to continue as she has been. Move out my friend and live a clean amazing life.
comments: Sounds like she's lazy and he would be better off without her. She can live in her dogs filth and he can find a girl who isn't a lazy dog owner like her.

answers.answer: No, you're not wrong. You can choose how you want to live.
I don't see a choice.  You can't live with things as they are.  She won't change anything.  You can either stay and constantly be upset or take your nice things and leave.
This probably belongs in relationships..  Not in dogs.
She isn't going to do anything about it.  After all these yrs of telling her you can't stand the filth & she hasn't done a thing about it.

question: Should I take my puppy to the vet?
details: I have a boxer pup coming up on 10 weeks old. I caught him drinking from a murky puddle over the weekend. Of course I stopped him but he drank from it. The concern comes a couple days later his poops are like gravy. However they improved to be be very very mushy turds. He’s pooping more than usual still and it’s very mushy. So his problem is getting better on its own but I’ve also read that pups are prone to parasites due to not having all of their shots yet. He isn’t acting sick at all. It’s just the poops that concern me

answers.answer: Or maybe it's cause he ate some gravy?
Yes.  He may have contracted worms or something else.

You need to call an consult your vet OR simply take in a FRESH fecal sample for testing.  Puppy can have ingested giardia or coccidea - (protozoans) from dirty water which will give him the runs & REQUIRE treatment.  Lepto is another possibility (and you may not have gotten any vaccination for that).
Would I take my dog to the Vet instead of (perhaps) deworming and weakening his immune system?  Yes.

Pups are born with internal parasites & need to be dewormed by your Vet.  Have you taken this pup in for its puppy shots yet?  They are pretty mandatory cause Parvovirus is DEADLY for puppies.  Get the shots started, a series of three shot.  To protect puppies from DEADLY puppyhood diseases.  Get pup wormed when you see the Vet.  Puppy shots are given every two to three weeks apart & the pup will not be ready to go out into the public until it is about 16 to 17 weeks of age.  Do not leave you home with the puppy unless you are taking it in to see a Vet & do not let the pup on the floor of the clinic if possible.  Sick animal go there.  You could carry it in a CRATE, that is what they are made for.
comments: He’s started his shots I think he has 1 round left. He just hasn’t finished them yet

answers.answer: Yes, the pup should go see the vet, minimally may have gastroenteritis from drinking nasty murky dirty contaminated water, besides a huge bacterial colony there may be things like antifreeze  runoff, Gasoline or some type of petroleum product which is hard on the gut if not fatal depending on if and how much there was if any.  With standing water you need worry about pesticides, fertilizers  or whatever chemicals were used or spilled in the area, some Times in hard flooding or long soaks chemicals can seep back out from the deep Into the standing water, they don’t always magically travel downwards.
comments: Puppy is NOT PROTECTED from Parvo by ONLY 1 round out of the 3 NECESSARY to prevent Parvovirus & DISTEMPER virus  NOT SAFE AT ALL!

answers.answer: Giardia can be picked up from standing water (as can Lepto) so when you take him in for his vaccination to be started, take a sample of his pooh with you for your vet to run a fecal, not just for worms, but for protozoa like Giardia.   Hopefully this is 'just' Giardia but this can be stubborn to clear.   Meanwhile clean the areas he empties properly (we had to use Jeyes Fluid with a pup we bought who came to us at 4 months with this) - didn't do much for the grass but that was too bad.   Use proper hygiene yourself too when dealing with this - Giardia can transfer to humans.
Yes he could have worms or a bad bacteria.  Adult dogs can drink from puddles and it’s not a big deal, but puppies aren’t as strong.  Their immune system isn’t fully developed yet.

question: How can I get my cat to stop laying down in the bathroom?
details: My cat's favorite place in the house is the bathroom. She spends most of her time laying down on the bathroom floor, sometimes even cuddled up to the toilet. It's just... kind of gross. Is there any way to discourage her from being in there (other than to use her litter box) and to encourage her to find a new spot to hang out? We've tried putting treats in her bed, but she just eats the treats and goes back into the bathroom

answers.answer: Spread its own feces on the floor. It will be appalled by its own scent
Its probably cooler in there.   Keep your bathroom clean if you think that its so gross.
Close the bathroom door.

Two reasons this might be happening. If you're like most of us and use bleach to clean your toilet and bathroom. The cat will love the smell for some reason. Or she is looking for someplace cool to rest. Our cat ROLLS around on the freshly cleaned and bleached floor purring like a baby. No matter what we do. We can't stop her. As long as your cat is not injesting cleaning products. She'll be fine. Our vet said it's fine if they roll around in it.
Move the litter box, and be sure to feed her elsewhere, too. The ceramic in most bathrooms is cool. Dogs usually try to find cool places. Perhaps your cat has long fur and your house is warm?
No idea.
Clearly she's seeking somewhere cool - you might find out why because most cats go for warmth.  Vet?

question: Where can I adopt a affordable Yorkie?
details: My dog of 11 years passed away 3 months ago. I really miss having a sweet little companion around. Where can I adopt a puppy for an affordable price. I can't pay thousands. 😞

answers.answer: Look up "Yorkshire Terrier Rescue (your state or zip code)" and you will find breed specific shelters.
Try adoptapet.com

It doesn't cost "thousands" to adopt.  Only breeders charge that much.  Shelters VERY seldom have ANY purebred puppies but they do have adults.  Why "must" it be a puppy?  Just go to petfinder.org and see what's available around you.
comments: ive seen some dogs on adoption pages like "petfinder" for $900. Why do they have the nerve to put an adoption fee at $900 i don't know. Most are usually $100-350

answers.answer: try looking in a breed rescue
If you want to ADOPT then go to: www.petfinder.com to look for Yorkies & Yorkie mixes listed in BOTH shelters & rescues (and done by distance) from the zip code you plug in.
call about the various shelters, PETA first (as they murder the "pets" within 24 hours).

Adoption, is via rescue centres and if you know a good Yorkie breeder who is running a dog on to see if they are suitable to show and will often foster them out to trusted people...often if they are suitable then the person just takes them to shows and they remain living with the person who has 'fostered' them.
comments: Nether would I 'advise' it, the answer was in response to the question asked, not for my advice

answers.answer: Petfinder.com

You can get a BYBed one for only a few hundred but they are BYBed & are not well bred or of good quality.  You can google to find the Yorkshire Terrier Rescue in your state.  You can look up small breed rescues in your state.  All of these are BYBed but they are Yorkies.

Be aware that Yorkies are little yappers. Why not go to the rescue shelter and see what they have. The last time we did that we came home with a miniature schnauzer that was smart as can be and a lot of fun. He is not a barker either.
comments: The shelters are EMPTY right now, or only have a few pit bull mixes.  Everybody (and his brother) HAS adopted during the Covid virus - to have a companion.

block off the dirty area. Contact the landlord and get this area blocked off. u don't seem to be concerned too much about the health of your dog, Be concernend about his health and do something about this dirty problem then u will be healthier too, Stop letting him loose where he can get at the sewer. Keep him on the leash or whatever.
OMG!!! NO!!  Yes you can get it from your dog.  You have a good reason to be 'concerned'.  It kills dogs & it is an awful death.
Stop letting your dog run loose.   Theres worse things than lepto that he can pick up in sewage

You have REPEATEDLY ASKED this - WHY?  The question has been ANSWERED.  If you do not trust what we have already posted in your PREVIOUS questions (of the exact same wording) then call up YOUR DOCTOR!
comments: Better would be the op´s therapist i reckon

question: Non-refundable pet deposit?
details: So we got the dog, but found out that I might be allergic to it. I spoke to the breeder way before and told her about my worries about the dog. She said if it doesn't work out in the future she'll take him back because she doesn't want to rehome him to another person. But I didnt agree to giving him back if it doesn't work out.

answers.answer: Why the F do we care? You handed over way too much money for a backyard breeder mutt. Up to them if they want to give you your money back.  If you took them to court you'd get NOTHING.

First of all, you made this problem, by not making sure you were not allergic to dogs. If you are older than 10 yrs old you should have had contact with dogs, and cats at sometime as a child and should already know if you are allergic.  But I learned you can become, allergic to a current pet you have had for a few yrs or more.  I would have gone to an animal shelter, and looked at a bunch of dogs and if I was allergic I would know.  However, you have the dog.  If you gave her full price and she will not give back the full price, turn around ab=nd sell the dog to someone else.  As I said, I think public breeding should be outlawed, because there are so many dogs who need a family.  and would not cost more than a few hundred and I got a dog for $85, and another for$60.  But you were willing to pay Almost $500, I am sure you can find another who is willing to do so.
A pet deposit sounds inhumane. Just keep it
You have no right to demand anything and that behavior will not go over well with anyone.  You have the right to ask for it - ask only.

To put it plain & simple, you got scammed & screw by blood thirsty BYBER.  They do this all the time.  They are people who are breeding their pets & produce low quality pus cause they do not do any of the pre breeding genetic testing or use selective breeding practices.
comments: She hasn't even got an allergy, just thinks she might have...

answers.answer: Non-refundable means you do not get your full money back.  Nothing to "demand".  Be thankful for getting $200 back.  In the future, get a contract from a reputable breeder.
comments: Least the shelter wouldn't screw them over.

answers.answer: As a grownass adult. You should have known to GET A CONTRACT ! Enjoy YOUR dog or your $200. You're screwed.
You have no right to demand anything at all.

Yes there is a contract, when you exchange money for 'goods', that forms a contract and you were very aware of this non refundable deposit  before you got the dog. The 'breeder' is not obligated to give you any money you paid back..... and "to be fair" you did not purchase a TV that doesn't work and wants a refund, you purchased a live animal that is perfectly 'fit for purpose'
This isnt walmart.  The breeder isnt obligated to return ANY of what you paid.   Thr dog isnt even WORTH the full amount that you paid anymore
comments: The breeder also has to deal with feeding and vet care while she finds an appropriate home.   A new home isnt going to pay the full price for an older pup/adult dog.
